english.title: The Forty Hadith of Shah Waliullah
english.author: Shah Waliullah Dahlawi
english.introduction: Forty Hadith of Shah Waliullah Dehlawi

english.text: The report is not like witnessing.
War is deception.
A Muslim is a mirror of the Muslim.
Someone whose advice is sought is in a position of trust.
The person guiding (someone) to do a good deed, is like the one performing the good deed.
Seek help for any needs discreetly.
Protect yourself from the fire even with a part of a date.

hadiths.arabic: الدُّنْیَا سِجْنُ الْمُؤمِنِ وَ جَنَّةُ الْکَافِرِ

english.text: The world is the believer’s prison and the disbeliever’s paradise.
Modesty is entirely good.
The word of the believer is like seizing of the hand.

hadiths.arabic: لَا یَحِلُّ لِمُؤمِنٍ اَنْ یَّجُهْرَ أخَاهُ فَوقَ ثَلَاثَةِ أیَّامٍ

english.text: It is unlawful for a believer to sever relations with his brother for more than three days.
He is not one of us who cheats us.

hadiths.arabic: مَا قَلَّ وَكَفَى خَيْرٌ مِمَّا كَثُرَ وَأَلْهَى

english.text: A little that suffices is better than an abundance that distracts.

hadiths.arabic: الرَّاجِعُ فِيْ هِبَتِهِ کَالرَّاجِعِ فِيْ قَیْئِهِ

english.text: Someone who takes back his gift is like someone who eats his vomit.
Affliction comes from (loose) talk.
People are like the teeth of a comb.
Richness lies in the richness of the soul.
The felicitous person takes lessons from (the actions of) others.

hadiths.arabic: وَ إِنَّ مِنَ الشِّعْرِ لَحِکْمَةً وَاِنَّ مِنَ الْبَیَانِ لَسِحْرًا

english.text: Indeed, in poetry there is wisdom and in eloquence there is magic.
The king’s pardon preserves the kingdom.
A man will be with whom he loves.
A man who knows his worth will not be ruined.
The child belongs to the bed and stoning is for the adulterer.

hadiths.arabic: الْیَدُ الْعُلْیَا خَیْرٌ مِّنَ الْیَدِ السُّفْلَی

english.text: The upper hand is superior to the lower hand.

hadiths.arabic: لَا شَکَرَ اللهَ مَنْ لَّا یَشْکُرُ النَّاسَ

english.text: He does not thank Allah who does not thank people.
Your love of something can blind and deafen (you).

hadiths.arabic: جُبِلَتِ الْقُلُوبُ عَلی حُبَّ مَنْ اَحْسَنَ اِلَیْهَا وَ بُغْضِ مَنْ اَسَاءَ اِلَیْهَا

english.text: Hearts are predisposed to love someone who does them good and detest someone who does them harm.

hadiths.arabic: الْتَّائِبُ مِنَ الذَّنْبِ کَمَنْ لَا ذَنْبَ لَهُ

english.text: One who repents from sin is like someone without sin.

hadiths.arabic: الشَّاهِدُ یَرَی مَا لَا یَرَاهُ الْغَائِبُ

english.text: The person who actually witnesses an (event) sees that which one who is absent does not.
If the nobleman of a people comes to you, honour him.
False oaths lay waste to home (lands).

hadiths.arabic: مَنْ قُتِلَ دُونَ مَالِهِ فَهُوَ شَهِیْدٌ

english.text: Whoever is killed attempting to save his property is a martyr.
Actions are through intentions.
The leader of a people is their servant.
The best of affairs is that which is balanced.

hadiths.arabic: اَللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ فِیْ أُمَّتِیْ فِی بُکُوْرِهَا یَوْمَ الْخَمِیْسِ

english.text: O Allah, bless my nation in its early rising on Thursdays!
Poverty can almost turn into disbelief.
Travelling is a portion of punishment.
The best of provision is God-Consciousness (taqwa).
Meetings are under trust.

chapter.english: Forty Hadith of Shah Waliullah Dehlawi
